SRGC Asia

Sarina Rhythmic Gymnastic

About us

There are many types of gymnastics comprising Acrobatics, Artistic Gymnastics, General Gymnastics, Rhythmic Gymnastics and Trampoline.

Rhythmic gymnastics is a discipline performed mostly by women, combining agility, artistry and grace accompanied by expressive interpretation of musics, while manipulating different types of apparatus.

History

Started as an illustration of expression through movement using rhythm and dance founded by Jean Georges Noverre and Francois Delsarte towards the end of the 19th and early 20th centuries, Rhythmic gymnastics was recognised be the Federation of International Gymnastics (FIG) in 1962 and was subsequently added as an Olympic sport in 1984.
